explainability.path_to_improvement: Document how explanations are provided to users affected by AI decisions.

external_accountability.path_to_improvement: Obtain external validation of AI practices or require vendor certifications.

fairness.path_to_improvement: Document bias testing procedures or vendor AI fairness requirements.

governance.findings: The company's Form 10-K Annual Report (2024) - Risk Factors Section acknowledges new technologies like generative AI as a potential source of increased or new risks to operations. This report also addresses the company's cybersecurity governance framework and its risk management processes.
governance.path_to_improvement: Name an AI governance body with defined mandate covering all AI use.

relevant_sources.summary: This SEC filing, the "Form 10-K Annual Report (2024) - Risk Factors Section," provides evidence for the **governance** pillar. The report acknowledges the emergence of new technologies like generative AI as a potential source of increased or new risks to operations, implying the need for governance and control over these technologies. Additionally, Item 1C of the filing addresses the company's cybersecurity governance framework and risk management processes, further supporting the governance pillar.
relevant_sources.title: Form 10-K Annual Report (2024) - Risk Factors Section

oversight.path_to_improvement: Document human review processes for AI-assisted decisions (built or vendor AI).

privacy.path_to_improvement: Document data protection practices for AI systems, including vendor AI data handling.

transparency.path_to_improvement: Document AI systems in use, including vendor/third-party AI tools.

summary.overall_findings: Governance is the only responsible AI pillar addressed in Plains GP's public disclosures, with its Form 10-K Annual Report (2024) acknowledging new technologies like generative AI as a potential source of increased risks and addressing the company's cybersecurity governance framework. These materials represent 1 of 7 evaluated pillars, drawing from 1 publicly available source. No qualifying public evidence was found for the majority of the 7 evaluated pillars.
